mdRecord.dcterms:title: Our battle-flag / Written by Edward Willet
O, never mind, boys! raise me up once again
Our battle flag
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Willett, Edward, 1830-1889 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil war song sheet in 3 verses, each followed by the refrain; without music; printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue. [original]
First line of text: O, never mind, boys! raise me up once again. [original]
First line of refrain: Then never mind, boys; I am ready to die. [original]
With advertisement "500 Illustrated Ballads lithographed and printed by Charles Magnus, No. 12 Frankfort Street, New York[.] Branch office, No. 520 7th St., Washington, D.C." [original]
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include his Washington, D.C. imprint were published about 1863 and 1864. [original]
Hand-colored headpiece of a woman holding a flag abover her head, Magnus 213A. Cf. American song sheets, 1768d. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Fourth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009. [original]
